image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: A South Australian nurse has been reprimanded by South Australia's Civil and Administrative Tribunal after admitting to fabricating documents in a bid to gain employment.

title.children: SA nurse banned after committing 'serious' professional misconduct

image.altText: Three men sit on a couch with blue wall paper behind them

props.synopsis: Streaming may have increased distribution opportunities for emerging filmmakers, but with limited box office opportunities, is rags-to-riches-success a thing of the past?

title.children: Will streaming put an end to surprise indie hits at the box office?

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing protective gloves holding a hot container with heated grass in it.

props.synopsis: In far west New South Wales, two Aboriginal men are drawing on the traditional knowledge of their ancestors to generate a source of income.

title.children: Aboriginal entrepreneurs harness ancient knowledge for new businesses

image.altText: Zak Butters flexes his muscles and pulls a funny face while Hawthorn players look disappointed

props.synopsis: The Port Adelaide-Hawthorn rivalry is very real, but also built on some rather odd foundations. In that sense, their Gather Round grand finale was more than fitting.

title.children: A silly rivalry gets a silly game as Port claims last Gather Round laugh

image.altText: Douglas Boyd conducting the Adelaide Symphony Orchestra in concert at the Adelaide Town Hall.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's culture of music has garnered global recognition, but some arts leaders say there's a missing piece of the puzzle.

title.children: 'A sore point': Adelaide's long wait for a purpose-built concert hall

image.altText: Two people in orange uniforms walk along a 1.5-metre high wall covered with tarp and along the bottom sand bags.

props.synopsis: With a floodwater levee wrapped around their town, residents in the remote South Australian community of Innamincka say they are stocked up and ready for weeks in isolation.

title.children: Locals prepared as floodwaters isolate remote SA township

image.altText: Wedges of blue cheese piled on a metal counter.

props.synopsis: Dairy farmers say the sector is struggling amid consumers turning to cheaper cheese imports flooding supermarket shelves.

title.children: Australians choosing cheaper imported cheese in cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Australia's remote desert mine plans for 40 more golden years

image.altText: A woman wearing a red blazer is talking with shadows in front of her

props.synopsis: Until the last election, the electorate of Boothby hadn't been in the hands of a Labor candidate since 1949 — but the ALP's Louise Miller-Frost broke that streak by winning the seat, and is now taking another tilt.

title.children: Labor won Boothby for the first time in 73 years — can it hold it?

image.altText: Dark grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO and Wine Australia are trialling fast-growing, mildew-resistant grapevines designed to maintain yield and wine quality in a changing climate.

title.children: Tiny vines could hold the key to a future-proof wine industry

image.altText: Three primary school kids holding up small whiteboards and smiling

props.synopsis: One in three Australian students are failing to reach proficiency in maths, and according to a new report, many teachers lack the confidence to teach it.

title.children: 'Too comfortable with mediocrity': 'Faddish' teaching blamed for maths failures

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a black cap with gold lettering that says 'Make America Great Again'.

props.synopsis: It seems only a matter of time before Donald Trump uses a crisis and the National Emergencies Act to bring about a revolution in the United States.

title.children: Trump's order on showerheads seems trivial but it's a subtle power grab

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: In the world of Chinese social media, you don't have to look far to find them — posts encouraging people to join the Russian army are being circulated on accounts with tens of thousands of followers.

title.children: 'Real men are here': The posts luring Chinese men to join Putin's army

image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: On opposite sides of the nation and of politics, rivals for the same job found themselves echoing familiar pitches, from housing to tax tweaks.

title.children: Labor not counting its chickens as Howard urges Dutton to 'bring home the bacon'

image.altText: Rory McIlroy on his knees

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy becomes the sixth man to complete golf's career grand slam, with a dramatic playoff victory at The Masters at Augusta National.

title.children: Career grand slam complete for Rory McIlroy with dramatic Masters win

image.altText: Bob Katter smiling in his office.

props.synopsis: Herding Bob Katter is not an easy task for his long-suffering but loyal staff, who battle to keep him on message. But when he wanders, it can turn into viral gold.

title.children: Bob Katter's never lost for words, but there's one topic that's off limits

image.altText: two men facing one another on a dark background one is red and one is blue

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are vying for your vote. Here’s what sets them apart.

title.children: What sets two of Australia's most powerful men apart from each other

image.altText: TikTok post about penjamin, or marijuana vape, disguised as air pods case.

props.synopsis: They can look just like a pen that actually works, lip gloss, a car key or an airpod case. They're called penjamins — disguised to look like everyday objects, allowing the user to vape cannabis discreetly.

title.children: Weed vapes disguised as pens, lip balm, even airpod cases

image.altText: Oscar Piastri with the Bahrain Grand Prix winner's trophy

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has driven a flawless race from pole position to win the Bahrain Grand Prix, his second win this Formula 1 season.

title.children: Piastri triumphs in the desert to win F1 Bahrain Grand Prix

image.altText: Pope Francis wearing white robes and a necklace with a golden cross, speaking into a microphone and gesturing with his hands

props.synopsis: The pontiff has greeted cardinals and followers of the Catholic Church at the Vatican, less than a month after battling double pneumonia.

title.children: Pope Francis makes unexpected appearance at Palm Sunday mass

image.altText: A female toddler with blonde hair sits on the lap of her mother, who is sitting by a garden

props.synopsis: A decade from now, I don't want to be explaining to my daughters why we've still failed to make progress on gynaecological cancers, writes Elise Worthington.

title.children: This cancer killed my mum and could come for my daughters and me

image.altText: A profil photo of Richard Zachariah wearing a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Zachariah was a journalist, author and co-hosted The Home Show on the ABC in the 1990s with the television personality and fashion icon Maggie Tabberer.

title.children: Former television and radio broadcaster Richard Zachariah dies aged 80

image.altText: A woman in a blazer and a pearl necklace

props.synopsis: Independent MP Monique Ryan says she would have to give thought to whether influencer content paid for by politicians should be clearly labelled as such, after fellow "teal" Allegra Spender revealed she had paid for posts.

title.children: Monique Ryan has 'no opinion' on influencers paid to post about politicians

image.altText: An older man and lady smiling looking at the camera

props.synopsis: John Green was an ABC reporter for 10 years and never thought he'd end up living on the streets. A mental health episode led to a decade sleeping rough.

title.children: Free camping grounds a haven for 'more people than ever' sleeping rough

image.altText: Grazier sits in shed.

props.synopsis: Steven Hall says the floods in western Queensland have wiped out most of his flock and destroyed 19 kilometres worth of fencing.

title.children: Grazier's 'heartbreaking' assessment after flood washes away stock, fences

image.altText: Wide shot of Newcastle Beach with breaking waves rolling onto the beach with the headland in the distance

props.synopsis: Police received reports early on Sunday morning that a woman had entered the water at Newcastle Beach and failed to return.

title.children: Search for swimmer missing off Newcastle Beach suspended

image.altText: MVDP is hit by a bidon

props.synopsis: Mathieu van der Poel accuses a fan of "attempted manslaughter" after a full bottle of water hit him in the face during the closing stages of the Paris-Roubaix cycling classic.

title.children: Fan accused of 'attempted manslaughter' after throwing water bottle at cyclist

image.altText: happy snowboarders

props.synopsis: International tourists, especially Australians, started to arrive en masse in the famous Japanese ski resort of Niseko in the early 2000s. Now the influx has pushed the cost of housing so high it's almost impossible for locals to compete with wealthy foreigners for property.

title.children: Foreign ski bums turned this Japanese mountain into a real estate nightmare

image.altText: Composite image of three people, a woman smiling, a man with blond hair and a woman talking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Politicians are on a mission this election to connect with voters online like never before. It is opening the door for podcasters and social media personalities to have increasing political influence.

title.children: 'Delulu with no solulu': Influencers changing how politicians campaign

image.altText: An older man and a younger woman look offscreen at something

props.synopsis: Star-studded satirical horror Death of a Unicorn is a refreshingly unique offering in a sea of remakes and reboots.

title.children: Killer unicorns offer a fresh take on the 'eat the rich' satire

image.altText: A teenage boy drawing on a paper and drinking juice

props.synopsis: An autistic and non-verbal teenage boy who was shot repeatedly by Idaho police has died after being removed from life support, his family says.

title.children: Teen with autism shot by Idaho police has died, his family confirms

image.altText: A destroyed neighbhourhood

props.synopsis: A Gaza Hospital has evacuated patients minutes before an Israeli air strike destroyed intensive care units.

title.children: Patients evacuated from Gaza hospital after Israeli airstrike

image.altText: A pair of hands are seen demonstrating how to brush dentures with a toothbrush.

props.synopsis: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

title.children: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson smirks behind the podium. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: Today might be the day you finally do OK at this quiz, but I'm not holding my breath.

title.children: You think you're good at quizzes? Let's test that theory
